revised_title: Attractive Scattering Potentials and Particle Concentration at the Origin
tldr: This article explores the effects of attractive scattering potentials on particle concentration at the origin in one, two, and three dimensions. It demonstrates that classical mechanics can provide a valid guide to understanding these effects, which depend crucially on the dimensionality of the system. The study focuses on potentials that are finite at the origin and discusses the square-well and exponential potentials as examples.
